meanings.definition: To move or propel with a quick, light snap.
meanings.sent1: She flicked the light switch off before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: He flicked the bug off his shoulder with a quick motion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel flicked the acorn at the unsuspecting cat.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers flicked through the pages of the book, searching for her favorite passage.
meanings.sent5: The magician flicked his wand, making the coin disappear in a flash.

meanings.definition: To strike or remove with a quick, light movement.
meanings.sent1: The chef flicked the excess flour off the cutting board.
meanings.sent2: She flicked the dust off the old photo frame before placing it on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat flicked the toy mouse across the room, chasing after it playfully.
meanings.sent4: The wind flicked the fallen leaves off the sidewalk, creating a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: He flicked the crumbs off the tablecloth, tidying up after the meal.

meanings.definition: To activate or turn on quickly and lightly.
meanings.sent1: She flicked the switch to turn on the lamp in the dark room.
meanings.sent2: He flicked the button to start the music playing on the stereo.
meanings.sent3: The child flicked the remote control, changing the TV channel repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: With a flick of his wrist, he flicked the lighter to ignite the flame.
meanings.sent5: She flicked the ignition key, starting the engine of the car smoothly.
